abstract.para: The &cloud; ‐ is a Web interface that allows cloud administrators to manage various &ostack; services, like managing and creating images, creating keypairs, or attaching volumes to instances. It is based on &ostack; ‐ (also known as Horizon). taroth 2012-07-04: not sure about the CLI - if it has the same scope, a basic administration chapter in front of this one migth be useful to explain the underlying logic - maybe something for next revision

sect1.title: Requirements

para.remark: taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, any requirements for the browser from which to use ‐ (Firefox, Chrome, Opera)? or does it work with any browser that supports HTML5 and JavaScript? I guess cookies need to be enabled?

sect1.para: The &cloud; ‐ back-end runs on the node that has the nova-dashboard server role.taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, is there any Web service that must be started on the respective node? which protocol and port is used for communication?

sect2.title: Logging Into the &cloud; ‐ as Administrator
sect2.para: To access the &cloud; ‐, ask the administrator of the &cloud; &admserv; for the following information:

listitem.para: IP address of the node that has the nova-dashboard server role.taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs - as there may be several IP addresses per node - which? the public one?
User name and password of the cloud administrator user with which you can log in to &cloud; ‐.

step.para: On any machine, start a Web browser and make sure that JavaScript and cookies are enabled.taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, does the machine running the browser need to be in the same network like the node which provides the WEB UI? or can it be accessed from anywhere?
As URL, enter the IP address that you got from the &admserv;'s administrator. taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs - http? https? and no ":port" needed?

para.remark: taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, may it happen that a certificate warning will appear at first login?

step.para: On the &cloud; ‐ login screen, enter the User Name and Password and click Sign In.
The ‐ screen appears, showing a Project and an Admin tab.
